pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:0.5: 58. The training rule on making stains
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:1.2: At that time a number of monks and wanderers were robbed by thieves while traveling from Sāketa to Sāvatthī.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:1.4: The King’s men set out from Sāvatthī and caught the thieves and their loot. They then sent a message to the monks:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:1.5: “Venerables, please come and pick out your own robes.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:1.6: But the monks did not recognize them.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:1.7: The people complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:1.8: “How can they not recognize their own robes?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:1.9: The monks heard the complaints of those people,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:1.11: He had the Order of monks assembled, gave a teaching on what is right and proper, and then addressed the monks,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:1.12: “Well then, monks, I will lay down a training rule for the following ten reasons:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:1.13: for the well-being of the Order, for the comfort of the Order, for the restraint of bad people, for the ease of well-behaved monks, for the restraint of corruptions in the present life, for avoiding corruptions in future lives, to give rise to confidence in those without it, to increase the confidence of those who have it,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:1.14: for the continuation of the true Teaching, and for supporting the training.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:1.15: And, monks, this training rule should be recited thus:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:1.16: ‘When a monk obtains a new robe, he should apply one of three kinds of stain: blue-green, mud-color, or dark brown. If a monk uses a new robe without applying any of the three kinds of stain, he commits an offense entailing confession.’
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:2.1.2: a mark has not been made is what is meant.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:2.1.4: one of the six kinds of robe.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:2.1.5: He should apply one of three kinds of stain:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:2.1.6: even if he just applies the amount on the tip of a blade of grass.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:2.1.8: there are two kinds of blue-green: the color of copper-sulphate and the color of leaves.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:2.1.14: If a monk […] without applying any of the three kinds of stain:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:2.1.15: if he uses a new robe without first applying one of the three kinds of stain, even if just the amount on the tip of a blade of grass, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:2.2.1: If it has not been applied, and he perceives that it has not, and he uses the robe, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:2.2.2: If it has not been applied, but he is unsure of it, and he uses the robe, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:2.2.3: If it has not been applied, but he perceives that it has, and he uses the robe, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:2.2.4: If it has been applied, but he perceives that it has not, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:2.2.5: If it has been applied, but he is unsure if it has, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:2.2.6: If it has been applied, and he perceives that it has, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:2.3.2: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:2.3.3: The eighth rule, the training rule on making stains, is finished.
